<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Voice from the Grave](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2200)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 117 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 1,700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This onyx skull emits eerie whispers when on its own, but when held the skull enables you to speak with [spirits](/Traits.aspx?ID=149) and [haunts](/Traits.aspx?ID=88) you can see, even if you don't share a language. The voice from the grave translates anything the spirit or haunt says, using a language you understand, and translates your words for the spirit or haunt in kind. This doesn't make the target [friendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=18) or even cooperative, but it does enable communication. The GM determines the language in the case of a haunt. You can't communicate with mindless spirits using the skull.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645)) **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** The onyx skull casts a DC 27 [_charm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) spell on one spirit or haunt you can communicate with using the skull. If you target a haunt that doesn't have a Will modifier, it automatically gets a failure on its save.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Voice from the Grave
